market_assessment.summary: This is a single storey commercial building situated within Maragua town in Muranga County. The building is characterized as a banking facility, while the neighbourhood is characterized with retail/wholesale shops and other businesses. Its location affords it good access and proximity to the basic infrastructural and social amenities within the town. The property was purposely built for banking purposes, and the ideal tenant would be a financial institution. We note that the property has not been occupied for some time, and a condition survey may be required to determine the extent of disrepair for subsequent renovation works. Maragua town is often described as a "sleepy" or "dormant" town, with challenges related to lack of infrastructure, social amenities, and economic stagnation. This has contributed to its relatively timid property market that has negatively affected property prices within the town. There are currently no obvious environmental issues including contaminated land either on the subject or on an adjoining site that materially affect the value of the property. A detailed environmental impact assessment would however be required to verify this. There was no evidence to suggest that this was once a public utility plot or was once a road reserve.

market_assessment.general_remarks: The subject property is an agricultural parcel located in the Sugutek area of Uasin Gishu County. It features a relatively flat terrain with red soil that is well-suited for crop cultivation. It is partly used for settlement hosting homesteads. The surrounding neighbourhood is predominantly agricultural, with both crop farming and livestock rearing being the primary economic activities. Infrastructure development in the area is modest, with most access roads being earth-surfaced. The tarmac road is approximately 7 kilometers away. Other basic social facilities such as schools are within the locality. The parcel hosts about three homesteads, evidence of occupation, a factor that may pose legal or logistical challenges at disposal. Disposing of the property under forced sale conditions may therefore be prolonged and potentially yield lower-than-expected proceeds. Demand for similar properties in the neighbourhood is modest as the property market is locally driven by the needs of the local population.

market_assessment.general_remarks: This is a three bedroom all ensuite bungalow situated in the out skirts of Ukunda Township, Ukunda, Kwale County. The immediate neighborhood was previously an agricultural but currently turning into residential area with bigger agricultural parcels being subdivided into smaller plots of 1/8, 4 and 2 acre sizes to cater for increase demand for residential properties within the area. The area is currently characterized by undeveloped plots and a blend of Swahili type residential houses, modern bungalows and maisonettes mainly for owner occupier purposes. Ukunda township is largely propelled by the tourism sector and particularly Diani tourist circuit that host renowned beach hotels and villas. The economy of the town and its greater hinterland therefore depend on the performance of the tourism sector. The improvement of infrastructure in the area especially Dongo Kundu bypass has further opened the area. The typical residential sector within the town is stable. The local economy is generally vibrant and demand for land for residential development is anticipated to remain stable in the short and medium term. Demand for similar type of developments is modest as the subject market is predominantly build-to-own residential sector.
